metadata.title: CVE-2021-38576 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A BIOS bug in firmware for a particular PC model leaves the Platformauthorization value empty. This can be used to permanently brick the TPM inmultiple ways, as well as to non-permanently DoS the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ovmf - 2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1
ovmf-ia32 - 2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1
qemu-efi - 2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1
qemu-efi-aarch64 - 2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1
qemu-efi-arm - 2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: edk2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2022.02-3ubuntu0.22.04.1').
